title: Variables
text: Represent the number of each type of coin using variables. The number of nickels is five more than two times the number of quarters, so you can represent as $$2q+5$$, and write pennies simply as q.

title: Multiplication
text: Multiple the number of each coin type(in variable form) by its respective value.

title: Conversion
text: Now, translate the expressions that were multiplied by their coin values into a single equation. This will be $$\operatorname{0.05}\left(2q+5\right)+0.25q=6.55$$.

title: Substitution
text: Plug q into the original relationship between the coins to find $$2q+5$$.

title: Calculation
text: The answer is 41 nickels and 18 quarters.
